name: 1 Kings 8:23
text: and he said, "Yahweh, the God of Israel, there is no God like you, in heaven above, or on earth beneath; who keep covenant and loving kindness with your servants, who walk before you with all their heart;

name: 1 Kings 8:24
text: who have kept with your servant David my father that which you promised him. Yes, you spoke with your mouth, and have fulfilled it with your hand, as it is this day.

name: 1 Kings 8:25
text: Now therefore, may Yahweh, the God of Israel, keep with your servant David my father that which you have promised him, saying, "There shall not fail you a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your children take heed to their way, to walk before me as you have walked before me."

name: 1 Kings 8:26
text: "Now therefore, God of Israel, please let your word be verified, which you spoke to your servant David my father.

name: 1 Kings 8:27
text: But will God in very deed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens can"t contain you; how much less this house that I have built!

name: 1 Kings 8:28
text: Yet have respect for the prayer of your servant, and for his supplication, Yahweh my God, to listen to the cry and to the prayer which your servant prays before you this day;

name: 1 Kings 8:29
text: that your eyes may be open toward this house night and day, even toward the place of which you have said, "My name shall be there;" to listen to the prayer which your servant shall pray toward this place.

name: 1 Kings 8:30
text: Listen to the supplication of your servant, and of your people Israel, when they shall pray toward this place. Yes, hear in heaven, your dwelling place; and when you hear, forgive.

name: 1 Kings 8:31
text: "If a man sins against his neighbor, and an oath is laid on him to cause him to swear, and he comes and swear before your altar in this house;

name: 1 Kings 8:32
text: then hear in heaven, and do, and judge your servants, condemning the wicked, to bring his way on his own head, and justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.

name: 1 Kings 8:33
text: "When your people Israel are struck down before the enemy, because they have sinned against you; if they turn again to you, and confess your name, and pray and make supplication to you in this house:

name: 1 Kings 8:34
text: then hear in heaven, and forgive the sin of your people Israel, and bring them again to the land which you gave to their fathers.

name: 1 Kings 8:35
text: "When the sky is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against you; if they pray toward this place, and confess your name, and turn from their sin, when you afflict them:

name: 1 Kings 8:36
text: then hear in heaven, and forgive the sin of your servants, and of your people Israel, when you teach them the good way in which they should walk; and send rain on your land, which you have given to your people for an inheritance.

name: 1 Kings 8:37
text: "If there is famine in the land, if there is pestilence, if there is blight, mildew, locust or caterpillar; if their enemy besieges them in the land of their cities; whatever plague, whatever sickness there is;

name: 1 Kings 8:38
text: whatever prayer and supplication is made by any man, or by all your people Israel, who shall each know the plague of his own heart, and spread forth his hands toward this house:

name: 1 Kings 8:39
text: then hear in heaven, your dwelling place, and forgive, and do, and render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart you know; (for you, even you only, know the hearts of all the children of men;)

name: 1 Kings 8:40
text: that they may fear you all the days that they live in the land which you gave to our fathers.

name: 1 Kings 8:41
text: "Moreover concerning the foreigner, who is not of your people Israel, when he shall come out of a far country for your name"s sake

name: 1 Kings 8:42
text: (for they shall hear of your great name, and of your mighty hand, and of your outstretched arm); when he shall come and pray toward this house;

name: 1 Kings 8:43
text: hear in heaven, your dwelling place, and do according to all that the foreigner calls to you for; that all the peoples of the earth may know your name, to fear you, as do your people Israel, and that they may know that this house which I have built is called by your name.

name: 1 Kings 8:44
text: "If your people go out to battle against their enemy, by whatever way you shall send them, and they pray to Yahweh toward the city which you have chosen, and toward the house which I have built for your name;

name: 1 Kings 8:45
text: then hear in heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.

name: 1 Kings 8:46
text: If they sin against you (for there is no man who doesn"t sin), and you are angry with them, and deliver them to the enemy, so that they carry them away captive to the land of the enemy, far off or near;

name: 1 Kings 8:47
text: yet if they shall repent in the land where they are carried captive, and turn again, and make supplication to you in the land of those who carried them captive, saying, "We have sinned, and have done perversely; we have dealt wickedly;"

name: 1 Kings 8:48
text: if they return to you with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their enemies, who carried them captive, and pray to you toward their land, which you gave to their fathers, the city which you have chosen, and the house which I have built for your name:

name: 1 Kings 8:49
text: then hear their prayer and their supplication in heaven, your dwelling place, and maintain their cause;

name: 1 Kings 8:50
text: and forgive your people who have sinned against you, and all their transgressions in which they have transgressed against you; and give them compassion before those who carried them captive, that they may have compassion on them

name: 1 Kings 8:51
text: (for they are your people, and your inheritance, which you brought out of Egypt, from the midst of the furnace of iron);

name: 1 Kings 8:52
text: that your eyes may be open to the supplication of your servant, and to the supplication of your people Israel, to listen to them whenever they cry to you.

name: 1 Kings 8:53
text: For you separated them from among all the peoples of the earth, to be your inheritance, as you spoke by Moses your servant, when you brought our fathers out of Egypt, Lord Yahweh."

name: 1 Kings 8:54
text: It was so, that when Solomon had made an end of praying all this prayer and supplication to Yahweh, he arose from before the altar of Yahweh, from kneeling on his knees with his hands spread forth toward heaven.

name: 1 Kings 8:55
text: He stood, and blessed all the assembly of Israel with a loud voice, saying,

name: 1 Kings 8:56
text: "Blessed be Yahweh, who has given rest to his people Israel, according to all that he promised. There has not failed one word of all his good promise, which he promised by Moses his servant.

name: 1 Kings 8:57
text: May Yahweh our God be with us, as he was with our fathers. Let him not leave us, nor forsake us;

name: 1 Kings 8:58
text: that he may incline our hearts to him, to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and his statutes, and his ordinances, which he commanded our fathers.

name: 1 Kings 8:59
text: Let these my words, with which I have made supplication before Yahweh, be near to Yahweh our God day and night, that he may maintain the cause of his servant, and the cause of his people Israel, as every day shall require;

name: 1 Kings 8:60
text: that all the peoples of the earth may know that Yahweh, he is God. There is none else.

name: 1 Kings 8:61
text: "Let your heart therefore be perfect with Yahweh our God, to walk in his statutes, and to keep his commandments, as at this day."

name: 1 Kings 8:62
text: The king, and all Israel with him, offered sacrifice before Yahweh.

name: 1 Kings 8:63
text: Solomon offered for the sacrifice of peace offerings, which he offered to Yahweh, two and twenty thousand head of cattle, and one hundred twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the children of Israel dedicated the house of Yahweh.

name: 1 Kings 8:64
text: The same day the king made the middle of the court holy that was before the house of Yahweh; for there he offered the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat of the peace offerings, because the bronze altar that was before Yahweh was too little to receive the burnt offering, and the meal offering, and the fat of the peace offerings.

name: 1 Kings 8:65
text: So Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great assembly, from the entrance of Hamath to the brook of Egypt, before Yahweh our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days.

name: 1 Kings 8:66
text: On the eighth day he sent the people away; and they blessed the king, and went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that Yahweh had shown to David his servant, and to Israel his people.

name: 1 Kings 9:1
text: It happened, when Solomon had finished the building of the house of Yahweh, and the king"s house, and all Solomon"s desire which he was pleased to do,

name: 1 Kings 9:2
text: that Yahweh appeared to Solomon the second time, as he had appeared to him at Gibeon.

name: 1 Kings 9:3
text: Yahweh said to him, "I have heard your prayer and your supplication, that you have made before me. I have made this house holy, which you have built, to put my name there forever; and my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.

name: 1 Kings 9:4
text: As for you, if you will walk before me, as David your father walked, in integrity of heart, and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded you, and will keep my statutes and my ordinances;

name: 1 Kings 9:5
text: then I will establish the throne of your kingdom over Israel forever, according as I promised to David your father, saying, "There shall not fail you a man on the throne of Israel."

name: 1 Kings 9:6
text: But if you turn away from following me, you or your children, and not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you, but shall go and serve other gods, and worship them;

name: 1 Kings 9:7
text: then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and this house, which I have made holy for my name, will I cast out of my sight; and Israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all peoples.

name: 1 Kings 9:8
text: Though this house is so high, yet shall everyone who passes by it be astonished, and shall hiss; and they shall say, "Why has Yahweh done thus to this land, and to this house?"

name: 1 Kings 9:9
text: and they shall answer, "Because they forsook Yahweh their God, who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold of other gods, and worshiped them, and served them. Therefore Yahweh has brought all this evil on them.""

name: 1 Kings 9:10
text: It happened at the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built the two houses, the house of Yahweh and the king"s house

name: 1 Kings 9:11
text: (now Hiram the king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and fir trees, and with gold, according to all his desire), that then king Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.

name: 1 Kings 9:12
text: Hiram came out from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him; and they didn"t please him.

name: 1 Kings 9:13
text: He said, "What cities are these which you have given me, my brother?" He called them the land of Cabul to this day.

name: 1 Kings 9:14
text: Hiram sent to the king one hundred twenty talents of gold.

name: 1 Kings 9:15
text: This is the reason of the levy which king Solomon raised, to build the house of Yahweh, and his own house, and Millo, and the wall of Jerusalem, and Hazor, and Megiddo, and Gezer.

name: 1 Kings 9:16
text: Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up, and taken Gezer, and burnt it with fire, and slain the Canaanites who lived in the city, and given it for a portion to his daughter, Solomon"s wife.

name: 1 Kings 9:17
text: Solomon built Gezer, and Beth Horon the lower,

name: 1 Kings 9:18
text: and Baalath, and Tamar in the wilderness, in the land,

name: 1 Kings 9:19
text: and all the storage cities that Solomon had, and the cities for his chariots, and the cities for his horsemen, and that which Solomon desired to build for his pleasure in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.

name: 1 Kings 9:20
text: As for all the people who were left of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not of the children of Israel;

name: 1 Kings 9:21
text: their children who were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel were not able utterly to destroy, of them Solomon raised a levy of bondservants to this day.

name: 1 Kings 9:22
text: But of the children of Israel Solomon made no bondservants; but they were the men of war, and his servants, and his princes, and his captains, and rulers of his chariots and of his horsemen.

name: 1 Kings 9:23
text: These were the chief officers who were over Solomon"s work, five hundred fifty, who bore rule over the people who labored in the work.

name: 1 Kings 9:24
text: But Pharaoh"s daughter came up out of the city of David to her house which Solomon had built for her: then he built Millo.

name: 1 Kings 9:25
text: Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar which he built to Yahweh three times a year, burning incense with them, on the altar that was before Yahweh. So he finished the house.

name: 1 Kings 9:26
text: King Solomon made a navy of ships in Ezion Geber, which is beside Eloth, on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.

name: 1 Kings 9:27
text: Hiram sent in the navy his servants, sailors who had knowledge of the sea, with the servants of Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 9:28
text: They came to Ophir, and fetched from there gold, four hundred and twenty talents, and brought it to king Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 10:1
text: When the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of Yahweh, she came to prove him with hard questions.

name: 1 Kings 10:2
text: She came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bore spices, and very much gold, and precious stones; and when she had come to Solomon, she talked with him of all that was in her heart.

name: 1 Kings 10:3
text: Solomon told her all her questions: there was not anything hidden from the king which he didn"t tell her.

name: 1 Kings 10:4
text: When the queen of Sheba had seen all the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,

name: 1 Kings 10:5
text: and the food of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their clothing, and his cup bearers, and his ascent by which he went up to the house of Yahweh; there was no more spirit in her.

name: 1 Kings 10:6
text: She said to the king, "It was a true report that I heard in my own land of your acts, and of your wisdom.

name: 1 Kings 10:7
text: However I didn"t believe the words, until I came, and my eyes had seen it. Behold, the half was not told me! Your wisdom and prosperity exceed the fame which I heard.

name: 1 Kings 10:8
text: Happy are your men, happy are these your servants, who stand continually before you, who hear your wisdom.

name: 1 Kings 10:9
text: Blessed is Yahweh your God, who delighted in you, to set you on the throne of Israel. Because Yahweh loved Israel forever, therefore made he you king, to do justice and righteousness."

name: 1 Kings 10:10
text: She gave the king one hundred twenty talents of gold, and of spices very great store, and precious stones. There came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 10:11
text: The navy also of Hiram, that brought gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug trees and precious stones.

name: 1 Kings 10:12
text: The king made of the almug trees pillars for the house of Yahweh, and for the king"s house, harps also and stringed instruments for the singers: there came no such almug trees, nor were seen, to this day.

name: 1 Kings 10:13
text: King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, besides that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned, and went to her own land, she and her servants.

name: 1 Kings 10:14
text: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred sixty-six talents of gold,

name: 1 Kings 10:15
text: besides that which the traders brought, and the traffic of the merchants, and of all the kings of the mixed people, and of the governors of the country.

name: 1 Kings 10:16
text: King Solomon made two hundred bucklers of beaten gold; six hundred shekels of gold went to one buckler.

name: 1 Kings 10:17
text: he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three minas of gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.

name: 1 Kings 10:18
text: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with the finest gold.

name: 1 Kings 10:19
text: There were six steps to the throne, and the top of the throne was round behind; and there were stays on either side by the place of the seat, and two lions standing beside the stays.

name: 1 Kings 10:20
text: Twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other on the six steps: there was nothing like it made in any kingdom.

name: 1 Kings 10:21
text: All king Solomon"s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 10:22
text: For the king had at sea a navy of Tarshish with the navy of Hiram: once every three years came the navy of Tarshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

name: 1 Kings 10:23
text: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth in riches and in wisdom.

name: 1 Kings 10:24
text: All the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.

name: 1 Kings 10:25
text: They brought every man his tribute, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and clothing, and armor, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.

name: 1 Kings 10:26
text: Solomon gathered together chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.

name: 1 Kings 10:27
text: The king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars made he to be as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland, for abundance.

name: 1 Kings 10:28
text: The horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt; and the king"s merchants received them in droves, each drove at a price.

name: 1 Kings 10:29
text: A chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for one hundred fifty; and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, they brought them out by their means.

name: 1 Kings 11:1
text: Now king Solomon loved many foreign women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians, and Hittites;

name: 1 Kings 11:2
text: of the nations concerning which Yahweh said to the children of Israel, "You shall not go among them, neither shall they come among you; for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods." Solomon joined to these in love.

name: 1 Kings 11:3
text: He had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines; and his wives turned away his heart.

name: 1 Kings 11:4
text: For it happened, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods; and his heart was not perfect with Yahweh his God, as was the heart of David his father.

name: 1 Kings 11:5
text: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.

name: 1 Kings 11:6
text: Solomon did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and didn"t go fully after Yahweh, as did David his father.

name: 1 Kings 11:7
text: Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, on the mountain that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech the abomination of the children of Ammon.

name: 1 Kings 11:8
text: So he did for all his foreign wives, who burnt incense and sacrificed to their gods.

name: 1 Kings 11:9
text: Yahweh was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned away from Yahweh, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice,

name: 1 Kings 11:10
text: and had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he didn"t keep that which Yahweh commanded.

name: 1 Kings 11:11
text: Therefore Yahweh said to Solomon, "Because this is done by you, and you have not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded you, I will surely tear the kingdom from you, and will give it to your servant.

name: 1 Kings 11:12
text: Notwithstanding I will not do it in your days, for David your father"s sake; but I will tear it out of the hand of your son.

name: 1 Kings 11:13
text: However I will not tear away all the kingdom; but I will give one tribe to your son, for David my servant"s sake, and for Jerusalem"s sake which I have chosen."

name: 1 Kings 11:14
text: Yahweh raised up an adversary to Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king"s seed in Edom.

name: 1 Kings 11:15
text: For it happened, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the army was gone up to bury the slain, and had struck every male in Edom

name: 1 Kings 11:16
text: (for Joab and all Israel remained there six months, until he had cut off every male in Edom);

name: 1 Kings 11:17
text: that Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father"s servants with him, to go into Egypt, Hadad being yet a little child.

name: 1 Kings 11:18
text: They arose out of Midian, and came to Paran; and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who gave him a house, and appointed him food, and gave him land.

name: 1 Kings 11:19
text: Hadad found great favor in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him as wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.

name: 1 Kings 11:20
text: The sister of Tahpenes bore him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh"s house; and Genubath was in Pharaoh"s house among the sons of Pharaoh.

name: 1 Kings 11:21
text: When Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the army was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, "Let me depart, that I may go to my own country."

name: 1 Kings 11:22
text: Then Pharaoh said to him, "But what have you lacked with me, that behold, you seek to go to your own country?" He answered, "Nothing, however only let me depart."

name: 1 Kings 11:23
text: God raised up an adversary to him, Rezon the son of Eliada, who had fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah.

name: 1 Kings 11:24
text: He gathered men to him, and became captain over a troop, when David killed them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and lived therein, and reigned in Damascus.

name: 1 Kings 11:25
text: He was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, besides the mischief of Hadad: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.

name: 1 Kings 11:26
text: Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephraimite of Zeredah, a servant of Solomon, whose mother"s name was Zeruah, a widow, he also lifted up his hand against the king.

name: 1 Kings 11:27
text: This was the reason why he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breach of the city of David his father.

name: 1 Kings 11:28
text: The man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valor; and Solomon saw the young man that he was industrious, and he put him in charge of all the labor of the house of Joseph.

name: 1 Kings 11:29
text: It happened at that time, when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; now Ahijah had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field.

name: 1 Kings 11:30
text: Ahijah laid hold of the new garment that was on him, and tore it in twelve pieces.

name: 1 Kings 11:31
text: He said to Jeroboam, "Take ten pieces; for thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "Behold, I will tear the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to you

name: 1 Kings 11:32
text: (but he shall have one tribe, for my servant David"s sake and for Jerusalem"s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel);

name: 1 Kings 11:33
text: because that they have forsaken me, and have worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of Moab, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon. They have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in my eyes, and to keep my statutes and my ordinances, as David his father did.

name: 1 Kings 11:34
text: ""However I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand; but I will make him prince all the days of his life, for David my servant"s sake whom I chose, who kept my commandments and my statutes;

name: 1 Kings 11:35
text: but I will take the kingdom out of his son"s hand, and will give it to you, even ten tribes.

name: 1 Kings 11:36
text: To his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a lamp always before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen me to put my name there.

name: 1 Kings 11:37
text: I will take you, and you shall reign according to all that your soul desires, and shall be king over Israel.

name: 1 Kings 11:38
text: It shall be, if you will listen to all that I command you, and will walk in my ways, and do that which is right in my eyes, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with you, and will build you a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel to you.

name: 1 Kings 11:39
text: I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not forever.""

name: 1 Kings 11:40
text: Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam; but Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 11:41
text: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, aren"t they written in the book of the acts of Solomon?

name: 1 Kings 11:42
text: The time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.

name: 1 Kings 11:43
text: Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 12:1
text: Rehoboam went to Shechem: for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.

name: 1 Kings 12:2
text: It happened, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat heard of it (for he was yet in Egypt, where he had fled from the presence of king Solomon, and Jeroboam lived in Egypt,

name: 1 Kings 12:3
text: and they sent and called him), that Jeroboam and all the assembly of Israel came, and spoke to Rehoboam, saying,

name: 1 Kings 12:4
text: "Your father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make you the grievous service of your father, and his heavy yoke which he put on us, lighter, and we will serve you."

name: 1 Kings 12:5
text: He said to them, "Depart for three days, then come back to me." The people departed.

name: 1 Kings 12:6
text: King Rehoboam took counsel with the old men, who had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, "What counsel do you give me to return answer to this people?"

name: 1 Kings 12:7
text: They spoke to him, saying, "If you will be a servant to this people this day, and will serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be your servants forever."

name: 1 Kings 12:8
text: But he forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him, and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him, who stood before him.

name: 1 Kings 12:9
text: He said to them, "What counsel do you give, that we may return answer to this people, who have spoken to me, saying, "Make the yoke that your father put on us lighter?""

name: 1 Kings 12:10
text: The young men who had grown up with him spoke to him, saying, "Thus you shall tell this people who spoke to you, saying, "Your father made our yoke heavy, but make it lighter to us;" you shall say to them, "My little finger is thicker than my father"s waist.

name: 1 Kings 12:11
text: Now whereas my father burdened you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.""

name: 1 Kings 12:12
text: So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king asked, saying, "Come to me again the third day."

name: 1 Kings 12:13
text: The king answered the people roughly, and forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him,

name: 1 Kings 12:14
text: and spoke to them according to the counsel of the young men, saying, "My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to your yoke. My father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions."

name: 1 Kings 12:15
text: So the king didn"t listen to the people; for it was a thing brought about of Yahweh, that he might establish his word, which Yahweh spoke by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.

name: 1 Kings 12:16
text: When all Israel saw that the king didn"t listen to them, the people answered the king, saying, "What portion have we in David? Neither do we have an inheritance in the son of Jesse. To your tents, Israel! Now see to your own house, David." So Israel departed to their tents.

name: 1 Kings 12:17
text: But as for the children of Israel who lived in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.

name: 1 Kings 12:18
text: Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was over the men subject to forced labor; and all Israel stoned him to death with stones. King Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.

name: 1 Kings 12:19
text: So Israel rebelled against the house of David to this day.

name: 1 Kings 12:20
text: It happened, when all Israel heard that Jeroboam was returned, that they sent and called him to the congregation, and made him king over all Israel: there was none who followed the house of David, but the tribe of Judah only.

name: 1 Kings 12:21
text: When Rehoboam had come to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah, and the tribe of Benjamin, a hundred and eighty thousand chosen men, who were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.

name: 1 Kings 12:22
text: But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,

name: 1 Kings 12:23
text: "Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people, saying,

name: 1 Kings 12:24
text: "Thus says Yahweh, "You shall not go up, nor fight against your brothers, the children of Israel. Everyone return to his house; for this thing is of me.""" So they listened to the word of Yahweh, and returned and went their way, according to the word of Yahweh.

name: 1 Kings 12:25
text: Then Jeroboam built Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and lived in it; and he went out from there, and built Penuel.

name: 1 Kings 12:26
text: Jeroboam said in his heart, "Now the kingdom will return to the house of David.

name: 1 Kings 12:27
text: If this people goes up to offer sacrifices in the house of Yahweh at Jerusalem, then the heart of this people will turn again to their lord, even to Rehoboam king of Judah; and they will kill me, and return to Rehoboam king of Judah."

name: 1 Kings 12:28
text: Whereupon the king took counsel, and made two calves of gold; and he said to them, "It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem. Look and see your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt!"

name: 1 Kings 12:29
text: He set the one in Bethel, and the other put he in Dan.

name: 1 Kings 12:30
text: This thing became a sin; for the people went to worship before the one, even to Dan.

name: 1 Kings 12:31
text: He made houses of high places, and made priests from among all the people, who were not of the sons of Levi.

name: 1 Kings 12:32
text: Jeroboam ordained a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like the feast that is in Judah, and he went up to the altar; he did so in Bethel, sacrificing to the calves that he had made: and he placed in Bethel the priests of the high places that he had made.

name: 1 Kings 12:33
text: He went up to the altar which he had made in Bethel on the fifteenth day in the eighth month, even in the month which he had devised of his own heart: and he ordained a feast for the children of Israel, and went up to the altar, to burn incense.

name: 1 Kings 13:1
text: Behold, there came a man of God out of Judah by the word of Yahweh to Beth El: and Jeroboam was standing by the altar to burn incense.

name: 1 Kings 13:2
text: He cried against the altar by the word of Yahweh, and said, "Altar, altar, thus says Yahweh: "Behold, a son shall be born to the house of David, Josiah by name. On you he shall sacrifice the priests of the high places who burn incense on you, and they will burn men"s bones on you.""

name: 1 Kings 13:3
text: He gave a sign the same day, saying, "This is the sign which Yahweh has spoken: Behold, the altar will be split apart, and the ashes that are on it will be poured out."

name: 1 Kings 13:4
text: It happened, when the king heard the saying of the man of God, which he cried against the altar in Bethel, that Jeroboam put out his hand from the altar, saying, "Seize him!" His hand, which he put out against him, dried up, so that he could not draw it back again to himself.

name: 1 Kings 13:5
text: The altar also was split apart, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of Yahweh.

name: 1 Kings 13:6
text: The king answered the man of God, "Now entreat the favor of Yahweh your God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored me again." The man of God entreated Yahweh, and the king"s hand was restored him again, and became as it was before.

name: 1 Kings 13:7
text: The king said to the man of God, "Come home with me, and refresh yourself, and I will give you a reward."

name: 1 Kings 13:8
text: The man of God said to the king, "Even if you gave me half of your house, I would not go in with you, neither would I eat bread nor drink water in this place;

name: 1 Kings 13:9
text: for so was it commanded me by the word of Yahweh, saying, "You shall eat no bread, nor drink water, neither return by the way that you came.""

name: 1 Kings 13:10
text: So he went another way, and didn"t return by the way that he came to Bethel.

name: 1 Kings 13:11
text: Now there lived an old prophet in Bethel; and one of his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Bethel. They also told their father the words which he had spoken to the king.

name: 1 Kings 13:12
text: Their father said to them, "Which way did he go?" Now his sons had seen which way the man of God went, who came from Judah.

name: 1 Kings 13:13
text: He said to his sons, "Saddle the donkey for me." So they saddled the donkey for him; and he rode on it.

name: 1 Kings 13:14
text: He went after the man of God, and found him sitting under an oak. He said to him, "Are you the man of God who came from Judah?" He said, "I am."

name: 1 Kings 13:15
text: Then he said to him, "Come home with me, and eat bread."

name: 1 Kings 13:16
text: He said, "I may not return with you, nor go in with you; neither will I eat bread nor drink water with you in this place.

name: 1 Kings 13:17
text: For it was said to me by the word of Yahweh, "You shall eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that you came.""

name: 1 Kings 13:18
text: He said to him, "I also am a prophet as you are; and an angel spoke to me by the word of Yahweh, saying, "Bring him back with you into your house, that he may eat bread and drink water."" He lied to him.

name: 1 Kings 13:19
text: So he went back with him, and ate bread in his house, and drank water.

name: 1 Kings 13:20
text: It happened, as they sat at the table, that the word of Yahweh came to the prophet who brought him back;

name: 1 Kings 13:21
text: and he cried to the man of God who came from Judah, saying, "Thus says Yahweh, "Because you have been disobedient to the mouth of Yahweh, and have not kept the commandment which Yahweh your God commanded you,

name: 1 Kings 13:22
text: but came back, and have eaten bread and drunk water in the place of which he said to you, "Eat no bread, and drink no water;" your body shall not come to the tomb of your fathers.""

name: 1 Kings 13:23
text: It happened, after he had eaten bread, and after he had drunk, that he saddled the donkey for the prophet whom he had brought back.

name: 1 Kings 13:24
text: When he had gone, a lion met him by the way, and killed him. His body was cast in the way, and the donkey stood by it. The lion also stood by the body.

name: 1 Kings 13:25
text: Behold, men passed by, and saw the body cast in the way, and the lion standing by the body; and they came and told it in the city where the old prophet lived.

name: 1 Kings 13:26
text: When the prophet who brought him back from the way heard of it, he said, "It is the man of God who was disobedient to the mouth of Yahweh. Therefore Yahweh has delivered him to the lion, which has mauled him and slain him, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke to him."

name: 1 Kings 13:27
text: He spoke to his sons, saying, "Saddle the donkey for me." They saddled it.

name: 1 Kings 13:28
text: He went and found his body cast in the way, and the donkey and the lion standing by the body. The lion had not eaten the body, nor mauled the donkey.

name: 1 Kings 13:29
text: The prophet took up the body of the man of God, and laid it on the donkey, and brought it back. He came to the city of the old prophet to mourn, and to bury him.

name: 1 Kings 13:30
text: He laid his body in his own grave; and they mourned over him, saying, "Alas, my brother!"

name: 1 Kings 13:31
text: It happened, after he had buried him, that he spoke to his sons, saying, "When I am dead, then bury me in the tomb in which the man of God is buried. Lay my bones beside his bones.

name: 1 Kings 13:32
text: For the saying which he cried by the word of Yahweh against the altar in Bethel, and against all the houses of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, will surely happen."

name: 1 Kings 13:33
text: After this thing Jeroboam didn"t return from his evil way, but again made priests of the high places from among all the people. Whoever wanted to, he consecrated him, that there might be priests of the high places.

name: 1 Kings 13:34
text: This thing became sin to the house of Jeroboam, even to cut it off, and to destroy it from off the surface of the earth.

name: 1 Kings 14:1
text: At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.

name: 1 Kings 14:2
text: Jeroboam said to his wife, "Please get up and disguise yourself, that you won"t be recognized as the wife of Jeroboam. Go to Shiloh. Behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, who spoke concerning me that I should be king over this people.

name: 1 Kings 14:3
text: Take with you ten loaves, and cakes, and a jar of honey, and go to him. He will tell you what will become of the child."

name: 1 Kings 14:4
text: Jeroboam"s wife did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.

name: 1 Kings 14:5
text: Yahweh said to Ahijah, "Behold, the wife of Jeroboam comes to inquire of you concerning her son; for he is sick. Thus and thus you shall tell her; for it will be, when she comes in, that she will pretend to be another woman."

name: 1 Kings 14:6
text: It was so, when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet, as she came in at the door, that he said, "Come in, you wife of Jeroboam! Why do you pretend to be another? For I am sent to you with heavy news.

name: 1 Kings 14:7
text: Go, tell Jeroboam, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: "Because I exalted you from among the people, and made you prince over my people Israel,

name: 1 Kings 14:8
text: and tore the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it you; and yet you have not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in my eyes,

name: 1 Kings 14:9
text: but have done evil above all who were before you, and have gone and made you other gods, and molten images, to provoke me to anger, and have cast me behind your back:

name: 1 Kings 14:10
text: therefore, behold, I will bring evil on the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam everyone who urinates on a wall, he who is shut up and he who is left at large in Israel, and will utterly sweep away the house of Jeroboam, as a man sweeps away dung, until it is all gone.

name: 1 Kings 14:11
text: He who dies of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat; and he who dies in the field shall the birds of the sky eat: for Yahweh has spoken it.""

name: 1 Kings 14:12
text: Arise therefore, and go to your house. When your feet enter into the city, the child shall die.

name: 1 Kings 14:13
text: All Israel shall mourn for him, and bury him; for he only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave, because in him there is found some good thing toward Yahweh, the God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam.

name: 1 Kings 14:14
text: Moreover Yahweh will raise him up a king over Israel, who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam. This is day! What? Even now.

name: 1 Kings 14:15
text: For Yahweh will strike Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water; and he will root up Israel out of this good land which he gave to their fathers, and will scatter them beyond the River, because they have made their Asherim, provoking Yahweh to anger.

name: 1 Kings 14:16
text: He will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he has sinned, and with which he has made Israel to sin."

name: 1 Kings 14:17
text: Jeroboam"s wife arose, and departed, and came to Tirzah. As she came to the threshold of the house, the child died.

name: 1 Kings 14:18
text: All Israel buried him, and mourned for him, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the prophet.

name: 1 Kings 14:19
text: The rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he warred, and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

name: 1 Kings 14:20
text: The days which Jeroboam reigned were two and twenty years: and he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 14:21
text: Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which Yahweh had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there: and his mother"s name was Naamah the Ammonitess.

name: 1 Kings 14:22
text: Judah did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they committed, above all that their fathers had done.

name: 1 Kings 14:23
text: For they also built them high places, and pillars, and Asherim, on every high hill, and under every green tree;

name: 1 Kings 14:24
text: and there were also sodomites in the land: they did according to all the abominations of the nations which Yahweh drove out before the children of Israel.

name: 1 Kings 14:25
text: It happened in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem;

name: 1 Kings 14:26
text: and he took away the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king"s house; he even took away all: and he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made.

name: 1 Kings 14:27
text: King Rehoboam made in their place shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, who kept the door of the king"s house.

name: 1 Kings 14:28
text: It was so, that as often as the king went into the house of Yahweh, the guard bore them, and brought them back into the guard room.

name: 1 Kings 14:29
text: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 1 Kings 14:30
text: There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.

name: 1 Kings 14:31
text: Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and his mother"s name was Naamah the Ammonitess. Abijam his son reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 15:1
text: Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat began Abijam to reign over Judah.

name: 1 Kings 15:2
text: He reigned three years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.

name: 1 Kings 15:3
text: He walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him; and his heart was not perfect with Yahweh his God, as the heart of David his father.

name: 1 Kings 15:4
text: Nevertheless for David"s sake, Yahweh his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem;

name: 1 Kings 15:5
text: because David did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, and didn"t turn aside from anything that he commanded him all the days of his life, except only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.

name: 1 Kings 15:6
text: Now there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.

name: 1 Kings 15:7
text: The rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? There was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.

name: 1 Kings 15:8
text: Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 15:9
text: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Asa to reign over Judah.

name: 1 Kings 15:10
text: He reigned forty-one years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.

name: 1 Kings 15:11
text: Asa did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, as did David his father.

name: 1 Kings 15:12
text: He put away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.

name: 1 Kings 15:13
text: Also Maacah his mother he removed from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah; and Asa cut down her image, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.

name: 1 Kings 15:14
text: But the high places were not taken away: nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect with Yahweh all his days.

name: 1 Kings 15:15
text: He brought into the house of Yahweh the things that his father had dedicated, and the things that himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.

name: 1 Kings 15:16
text: There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

name: 1 Kings 15:17
text: Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.

name: 1 Kings 15:18
text: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of Yahweh, and the treasures of the king"s house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants; and king Asa sent them to Ben Hadad, the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who lived at Damascus, saying,

name: 1 Kings 15:19
text: "There is a treaty between me and you, between my father and your father. Behold, I have sent to you a present of silver and gold. Go, break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me."

name: 1 Kings 15:20
text: Ben Hadad listened to king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel, and struck Ijon, and Dan, and Abel Beth Maacah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.

name: 1 Kings 15:21
text: It happened, when Baasha heard of it, that he left off building Ramah, and lived in Tirzah.

name: 1 Kings 15:22
text: Then king Asa made a proclamation to all Judah; none was exempted: and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and its timber, with which Baasha had built; and king Asa built therewith Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.

name: 1 Kings 15:23
text: Now the rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? But in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.

name: 1 Kings 15:24
text: Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father; and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 15:25
text: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah; and he reigned over Israel two years.

name: 1 Kings 15:26
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.

name: 1 Kings 15:27
text: Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha struck him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel were laying siege to Gibbethon.

name: 1 Kings 15:28
text: Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha killed him, and reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 15:29
text: It happened that, as soon as he was king, he struck all the house of Jeroboam: he didn"t leave to Jeroboam any who breathed, until he had destroyed him; according to the saying of Yahweh, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite;

name: 1 Kings 15:30
text: for the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and with which he made Israel to sin, because of his provocation with which he provoked Yahweh, the God of Israel, to anger.

name: 1 Kings 15:31
text: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 1 Kings 15:32
text: There was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.

name: 1 Kings 15:33
text: In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha the son of Ahijah began to reign over all Israel in Tirzah for twenty-four years.

name: 1 Kings 15:34
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.

name: 1 Kings 16:1
text: The word of Yahweh came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,

name: 1 Kings 16:2
text: "Because I exalted you out of the dust, and made you prince over my people Israel, and you have walked in the way of Jeroboam, and have made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;

name: 1 Kings 16:3
text: behold, I will utterly sweep away Baasha and his house; and I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.

name: 1 Kings 16:4
text: The dogs will eat Baasha"s descendants who die in the city; and he who dies of his in the field the birds of the sky will eat."

name: 1 Kings 16:5
text: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, and what he did, and his might, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 1 Kings 16:6
text: Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah; and Elah his son reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 16:7
text: Moreover by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani came the word of Yahweh against Baasha, and against his house, both because of all the evil that he did in the sight of Yahweh, to provoke him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam, and because he struck him.

name: 1 Kings 16:8
text: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha began to reign over Israel in Tirzah for two years.

name: 1 Kings 16:9
text: His servant Zimri, captain of half his chariots, conspired against him. Now he was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, who was over the household in Tirzah:

name: 1 Kings 16:10
text: and Zimri went in and struck him, and killed him, in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 16:11
text: It happened, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat on his throne, that he struck all the house of Baasha: he didn"t leave him a single one who urinates on a wall, neither of his relatives, nor of his friends.

name: 1 Kings 16:12
text: Thus Zimri destroyed all the house of Baasha, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,

name: 1 Kings 16:13
text: for all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, which they sinned, and with which they made Israel to sin, to provoke Yahweh, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.

name: 1 Kings 16:14
text: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 1 Kings 16:15
text: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri reigned seven days in Tirzah. Now the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.

name: 1 Kings 16:16
text: The people who were encamped heard say, Zimri has conspired, and has also struck the king: therefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.

name: 1 Kings 16:17
text: Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.

name: 1 Kings 16:18
text: It happened, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the castle of the king"s house, and burnt the king"s house over him with fire, and died,

name: 1 Kings 16:19
text: for his sins which he sinned in doing that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he did, to make Israel to sin.

name: 1 Kings 16:20
text: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and his treason that he committed, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 1 Kings 16:21
text: Then were the people of Israel divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.

name: 1 Kings 16:22
text: But the people who followed Omri prevailed against the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.

name: 1 Kings 16:23
text: In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri began to reign over Israel for twelve years. He reigned six years in Tirzah.

name: 1 Kings 16:24
text: He bought the hill Samaria of Shemer for two talents of silver; and he built on the hill, and called the name of the city which he built, after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill, Samaria.

name: 1 Kings 16:25
text: Omri did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and dealt wickedly above all who were before him.

name: 1 Kings 16:26
text: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sins with which he made Israel to sin, to provoke Yahweh, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.

name: 1 Kings 16:27
text: Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and his might that he showed, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 1 Kings 16:28
text: So Omri slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria; and Ahab his son reigned in his place.

name: 1 Kings 16:29
text: In the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty-two years.

name: 1 Kings 16:30
text: Ahab the son of Omri did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh above all that were before him.

name: 1 Kings 16:31
text: It happened, as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, that he took as wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians, and went and served Baal, and worshiped him.

name: 1 Kings 16:32
text: He reared up an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.

name: 1 Kings 16:33
text: Ahab made the Asherah; and Ahab did yet more to provoke Yahweh, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel who were before him.

name: 1 Kings 16:34
text: In his days Hiel the Bethelite built Jericho: he laid its foundation with the loss of Abiram his firstborn, and set up its gates with the loss of his youngest son Segub, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke by Joshua the son of Nun.

name: 1 Kings 17:1
text: Elijah the Tishbite, who was of the foreigners of Gilead, said to Ahab, "As Yahweh, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word."

name: 1 Kings 17:2
text: The word of Yahweh came to him, saying,

name: 1 Kings 17:3
text: "Go away from here, turn eastward, and hide yourself by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan.

name: 1 Kings 17:4
text: It shall be, that you shall drink of the brook. I have commanded the ravens to feed you there."

name: 1 Kings 17:5
text: So he went and did according to the word of Yahweh; for he went and lived by the brook Cherith, that is before the Jordan.

name: 1 Kings 17:6
text: The ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.

name: 1 Kings 17:7
text: It happened after a while, that the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.

name: 1 Kings 17:8
text: The word of Yahweh came to him, saying,

name: 1 Kings 17:9
text: "Arise, go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and stay there. Behold, I have commanded a widow there to sustain you."

name: 1 Kings 17:10
text: So he arose and went to Zarephath; and when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks: and he called to her, and said, "Please get me a little water in a vessel, that I may drink."

name: 1 Kings 17:11
text: As she was going to get it, he called to her, and said, "Please bring me a morsel of bread in your hand."

name: 1 Kings 17:12
text: She said, "As Yahweh your God lives, I don"t have a cake, but a handful of meal in the jar, and a little oil in the jar. Behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and bake it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die."

name: 1 Kings 17:13
text: Elijah said to her, "Don"t be afraid. Go and do as you have said; but make me of it a little cake first, and bring it out to me, and afterward make some for you and for your son.

name: 1 Kings 17:14
text: For thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "The jar of meal shall not empty, neither shall the jar of oil fail, until the day that Yahweh sends rain on the earth.""

name: 1 Kings 17:15
text: She went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, ate many days.

name: 1 Kings 17:16
text: The jar of meal didn"t empty, neither did the jar of oil fail, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke by Elijah.

name: 1 Kings 17:17
text: It happened after these things, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so severe, that there was no breath left in him.

name: 1 Kings 17:18
text: She said to Elijah, "What have I to do with you, you man of God? You have come to me to bring my sin to memory, and to kill my son!"

name: 1 Kings 17:19
text: He said to her, "Give me your son." He took him out of her bosom, and carried him up into the room where he stayed, and laid him on his own bed.

name: 1 Kings 17:20
text: He cried to Yahweh, and said, "Yahweh my God, have you also brought evil on the widow with whom I stay, by killing her son?"

name: 1 Kings 17:21
text: He stretched himself on the child three times, and cried to Yahweh, and said, "Yahweh my God, please let this child"s soul come into him again."

name: 1 Kings 17:22
text: Yahweh listened to the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came into him again, and he revived.

name: 1 Kings 17:23
text: Elijah took the child, and brought him down out of the room into the house, and delivered him to his mother; and Elijah said, "Behold, your son lives."

name: 1 Kings 17:24
text: The woman said to Elijah, "Now I know that you are a man of God, and that the word of Yahweh in your mouth is truth."

name: 1 Kings 18:1
text: It happened after many days, that the word of Yahweh came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, "Go, show yourself to Ahab; and I will send rain on the earth."

name: 1 Kings 18:2
text: Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. The famine was severe in Samaria.

name: 1 Kings 18:3
text: Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared Yahweh greatly:

name: 1 Kings 18:4
text: for it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of Yahweh, that Obadiah took one hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)

name: 1 Kings 18:5
text: Ahab said to Obadiah, "Go through the land, to all the springs of water, and to all the brooks. Perhaps we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, that we not lose all the animals."

name: 1 Kings 18:6
text: So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.

name: 1 Kings 18:7
text: As Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he recognized him, and fell on his face, and said, "Is it you, my lord Elijah?"

name: 1 Kings 18:8
text: He answered him, "It is I. Go, tell your lord, "Behold, Elijah is here!""

name: 1 Kings 18:9
text: He said, "Wherein have I sinned, that you would deliver your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?

name: 1 Kings 18:10
text: As Yahweh your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom, where my lord has not sent to seek you. When they said, "He is not here," he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they didn"t find you.

name: 1 Kings 18:11
text: Now you say, "Go, tell your lord, "Behold, Elijah is here.""

name: 1 Kings 18:12
text: It will happen, as soon as I am gone from you, that the Spirit of Yahweh will carry you I don"t know where; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he can"t find you, he will kill me. But I, your servant, have feared Yahweh from my youth.

name: 1 Kings 18:13
text: Wasn"t it told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of Yahweh, how I hid one hundred men of Yahweh"s prophets with fifty to a cave, and fed them with bread and water?

name: 1 Kings 18:14
text: Now you say, "Go, tell your lord, "Behold, Elijah is here;"" and he will kill me."

name: 1 Kings 18:15
text: Elijah said, "As Yahweh of Armies lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today."

name: 1 Kings 18:16
text: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.

name: 1 Kings 18:17
text: It happened, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said to him, "Is that you, you troubler of Israel?"

name: 1 Kings 18:18
text: He answered, "I have not troubled Israel; but you, and your father"s house, in that you have forsaken the commandments of Yahweh, and you have followed the Baals.

name: 1 Kings 18:19
text: Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel to Mount Carmel, and four hundred fifty of the prophets of Baal, and four hundred of the prophets of the Asherah, who eat at Jezebel"s table."

name: 1 Kings 18:20
text: So Ahab sent to all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets together to Mount Carmel.

name: 1 Kings 18:21
text: Elijah came near to all the people, and said, "How long will you waver between the two sides? If Yahweh is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him." The people answered him not a word.

name: 1 Kings 18:22
text: Then Elijah said to the people, "I, even I only, am left a prophet of Yahweh; but Baal"s prophets are four hundred fifty men.

name: 1 Kings 18:23
text: Let them therefore give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under it.

name: 1 Kings 18:24
text: You call on the name of your god, and I will call on the name of Yahweh. The God who answers by fire, let him be God." All the people answered, "It is well said."

name: 1 Kings 18:25
text: Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, "Choose one bull for yourselves, and dress it first; for you are many; and call on the name of your god, but put no fire under it."

name: 1 Kings 18:26
text: They took the bull which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any who answered. They leaped about the altar which was made.

name: 1 Kings 18:27
text: It happened at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, "Cry aloud; for he is a god. Either he is musing, or he has gone aside, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he sleeps and must be awakened."

name: 1 Kings 18:28
text: They cried aloud, and cut themselves in their way with knives and lances, until the blood gushed out on them.

name: 1 Kings 18:29
text: It was so, when midday was past, that they prophesied until the time of the offering of the offering; but there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any who regarded.

name: 1 Kings 18:30
text: Elijah said to all the people, "Come near to me;" and all the people came near to him. He repaired the altar of Yahweh that was thrown down.

name: 1 Kings 18:31
text: Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of Yahweh came, saying, "Israel shall be your name."

name: 1 Kings 18:32
text: With the stones he built an altar in the name of Yahweh. He made a trench around the altar, large enough to contain two measures of seed.

name: 1 Kings 18:33
text: He put the wood in order, and cut the bull in pieces, and laid it on the wood. He said, "Fill four jars with water, and pour it on the burnt offering, and on the wood."

name: 1 Kings 18:34
text: He said, "Do it a second time;" and they did it the second time. He said, "Do it a third time;" and they did it the third time.

name: 1 Kings 18:35
text: The water ran around the altar; and he also filled the trench with water.

name: 1 Kings 18:36
text: It happened at the time of the offering of the offering, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, "Yahweh, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.

name: 1 Kings 18:37
text: Hear me, Yahweh, hear me, that this people may know that you, Yahweh, are God, and that you have turned their heart back again."

name: 1 Kings 18:38
text: Then the fire of Yahweh fell, and consumed the burnt offering, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.

name: 1 Kings 18:39
text: When all the people saw it, they fell on their faces. They said, "Yahweh, he is God! Yahweh, he is God!"

name: 1 Kings 18:40
text: Elijah said to them, "Seize the prophets of Baal! Don"t let one of them escape!" They seized them. Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and killed them there.

name: 1 Kings 18:41
text: Elijah said to Ahab, "Get up, eat and drink; for there is the sound of abundance of rain."

name: 1 Kings 18:42
text: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he bowed himself down on the earth, and put his face between his knees.

name: 1 Kings 18:43
text: He said to his servant, "Go up now, look toward the sea." He went up, and looked, and said, "There is nothing." He said, "Go again" seven times.

name: 1 Kings 18:44
text: It happened at the seventh time, that he said, "Behold, a small cloud, like a man"s hand, is rising out of the sea." He said, "Go up, tell Ahab, "Get ready and go down, so that the rain doesn"t stop you.""

name: 1 Kings 18:45
text: It happened in a little while, that the sky grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.

name: 1 Kings 18:46
text: The hand of Yahweh was on Elijah; and he tucked his cloak into his belt and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.

name: 1 Kings 19:1
text: Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.

name: 1 Kings 19:2
text: Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, "So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I don"t make your life as the life of one of them by tomorrow about this time!"

name: 1 Kings 19:3
text: When he saw that, he arose, and went for his life, and came to Beersheba, which belongs to Judah, and left his servant there.

name: 1 Kings 19:4
text: But he himself went a day"s journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper tree: and he requested for himself that he might die, and said, "It is enough. Now, O Yahweh, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers."

name: 1 Kings 19:5
text: He lay down and slept under a juniper tree; and behold, an angel touched him, and said to him, "Arise and eat!"

name: 1 Kings 19:6
text: He looked, and behold, there was at his head a cake baked on the coals, and a jar of water. He ate and drank, and lay down again.

name: 1 Kings 19:7
text: The angel of Yahweh came again the second time, and touched him, and said, "Arise and eat, because the journey is too great for you."

name: 1 Kings 19:8
text: He arose, and ate and drank, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb the Mount of God.

name: 1 Kings 19:9
text: He came there to a cave, and lodged there; and behold, the word of Yahweh came to him, and he said to him, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"

name: 1 Kings 19:10
text: He said, "I have been very jealous for Yahweh, the God of Armies; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and slain your prophets with the sword. I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away."

name: 1 Kings 19:11
text: He said, "Go out, and stand on the mountain before Yahweh." Behold, Yahweh passed by, and a great and strong wind tore the mountains, and broke in pieces the rocks before Yahweh; but Yahweh was not in the wind. After the wind an earthquake; but Yahweh was not in the earthquake.

name: 1 Kings 19:12
text: After the earthquake a fire passed; but Yahweh was not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voice.

name: 1 Kings 19:13
text: It was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. Behold, a voice came to him, and said, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"

name: 1 Kings 19:14
text: He said, "I have been very jealous for Yahweh, the God of Armies; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and slain your prophets with the sword. I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away."

name: 1 Kings 19:15
text: Yahweh said to him, "Go, return on your way to the wilderness of Damascus. When you arrive, you shall anoint Hazael to be king over Syria.

name: 1 Kings 19:16
text: You shall anoint Jehu the son of Nimshi to be king over Israel; and you shall anoint Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel Meholah to be prophet in your place.

name: 1 Kings 19:17
text: It shall happen, that he who escapes from the sword of Hazael, Jehu will kill; and he who escapes from the sword of Jehu, Elisha will kill.

name: 1 Kings 19:18
text: Yet will I leave seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth which has not kissed him."

name: 1 Kings 19:19
text: So he departed there, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing, with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed over to him, and cast his mantle on him.

name: 1 Kings 19:20
text: He left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, "Let me please kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow you." He said to him, "Go back again; for what have I done to you?"

name: 1 Kings 19:21
text: He returned from following him, and took the yoke of oxen, and killed them, and boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen, and gave to the people, and they ate. Then he arose, and went after Elijah, and served him.

name: 1 Kings 20:1
text: Ben Hadad the king of Syria gathered all his army together; and there were thirty-two kings with him, and horses and chariots: and he went up and besieged Samaria, and fought against it.

name: 1 Kings 20:2
text: He sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel, into the city, and said to him, "Thus says Ben Hadad,

name: 1 Kings 20:3
text: "Your silver and your gold is mine. Your wives also and your children, even the best, are mine.""

name: 1 Kings 20:4
text: The king of Israel answered, "It is according to your saying, my lord, O king. I am yours, and all that I have."

name: 1 Kings 20:5
text: The messengers came again, and said, "Ben Hadad says, "I sent indeed to you, saying, "You shall deliver me your silver, and your gold, and your wives, and your children;

name: 1 Kings 20:6
text: but I will send my servants to you tomorrow about this time, and they shall search your house, and the houses of your servants; and it shall be, that whatever is pleasant in your eyes, they shall put it in their hand, and take it away."""

name: 1 Kings 20:7
text: Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, "Please notice how this man seeks mischief; for he sent to me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold; and I didn"t deny him."

name: 1 Kings 20:8
text: All the elders and all the people said to him, "Don"t listen, neither consent."

name: 1 Kings 20:9
text: Therefore he said to the messengers of Ben Hadad, "Tell my lord the king, "All that you sent for to your servant at the first I will do; but this thing I cannot do."" The messengers departed, and brought him back the message.

name: 1 Kings 20:10
text: Ben Hadad sent to him, and said, "The gods do so to me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people who follow me."

name: 1 Kings 20:11
text: The king of Israel answered, "Tell him, "Don"t let him who puts on his armor brag like he who takes it off.""

name: 1 Kings 20:12
text: It happened, when Ben Hadad heard this message, as he was drinking, he and the kings, in the pavilions, that he said to his servants, "Prepare to attack!" They prepared to attack the city.

name: 1 Kings 20:13
text: Behold, a prophet came near to Ahab king of Israel, and said, "Thus says Yahweh, "Have you seen all this great multitude? Behold, I will deliver it into your hand this day; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.""

name: 1 Kings 20:14
text: Ahab said, "By whom?" He said, "Thus says Yahweh, "By the young men of the princes of the provinces."" Then he said, "Who shall begin the battle?" He answered, "You."

name: 1 Kings 20:15
text: Then he mustered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty-two. After them, he mustered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.

name: 1 Kings 20:16
text: They went out at noon. But Ben Hadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty-two kings who helped him.

name: 1 Kings 20:17
text: The young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben Hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, "Men are coming out from Samaria."

name: 1 Kings 20:18
text: He said, "If they have come out for peace, take them alive; or if they have come out for war, take them alive."

name: 1 Kings 20:19
text: So these went out of the city, the young men of the princes of the provinces, and the army which followed them.

name: 1 Kings 20:20
text: They each killed his man. The Syrians fled, and Israel pursued them. Ben Hadad the king of Syria escaped on a horse with horsemen.

name: 1 Kings 20:21
text: The king of Israel went out, and struck the horses and chariots, and killed the Syrians with a great slaughter.

name: 1 Kings 20:22
text: The prophet came near to the king of Israel, and said to him, "Go, strengthen yourself, and mark, and see what you do; for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against you."

name: 1 Kings 20:23
text: The servants of the king of Syria said to him, "Their god is a god of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we. But let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.

name: 1 Kings 20:24
text: Do this thing: take the kings away, every man out of his place, and put captains in their place.

name: 1 Kings 20:25
text: Muster an army, like the army that you have lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot. We will fight against them in the plain, and surely we will be stronger than them." He listened to their voice, and did so.

name: 1 Kings 20:26
text: It happened at the return of the year, that Ben Hadad mustered the Syrians, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel.

name: 1 Kings 20:27
text: The children of Israel were mustered, and were provisioned, and went against them. The children of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of young goats; but the Syrians filled the country.

name: 1 Kings 20:28
text: A man of God came near and spoke to the king of Israel, and said, "Thus says Yahweh, "Because the Syrians have said, "Yahweh is a god of the hills, but he is not a god of the valleys;" therefore I will deliver all this great multitude into your hand, and you shall know that I am Yahweh.""

name: 1 Kings 20:29
text: They encamped one over against the other seven days. So it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined; and the children of Israel killed one hundred thousand footmen of the Syrians in one day.

name: 1 Kings 20:30
text: But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and the wall fell on twenty-seven thousand men who were left. Ben Hadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner room.

name: 1 Kings 20:31
text: His servants said to him, "See now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings. Please let us put sackcloth on our bodies, and ropes on our heads, and go out to the king of Israel. Maybe he will save your life."

name: 1 Kings 20:32
text: So they put sackcloth on their bodies and ropes on their heads, and came to the king of Israel, and said, "Your servant Ben Hadad says, "Please let me live."" He said, "Is he still alive? He is my brother."

name: 1 Kings 20:33
text: Now the men observed diligently, and hurried to take this phrase; and they said, "Your brother Ben Hadad." Then he said, "Go, bring him." Then Ben Hadad came out to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.

name: 1 Kings 20:34
text: Ben Hadad said to him, "The cities which my father took from your father I will restore. You shall make streets for yourself in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria." "I," said Ahab, "will let you go with this covenant." So he made a covenant with him, and let him go.

name: 1 Kings 20:35
text: A certain man of the sons of the prophets said to his fellow by the word of Yahweh, "Please strike me!" The man refused to strike him.

name: 1 Kings 20:36
text: Then he said to him, "Because you have not obeyed the voice of Yahweh, behold, as soon as you are departed from me, a lion shall kill you." As soon as he was departed from him, a lion found him, and killed him.

name: 1 Kings 20:37
text: Then he found another man, and said, "Please strike me." The man struck him, smiting and wounding him.

name: 1 Kings 20:38
text: So the prophet departed, and waited for the king by the way, and disguised himself with his headband over his eyes.

name: 1 Kings 20:39
