text: (Yahweh gave Israel a savior, so that they went out from under the hand of the Syrians; and the children of Israel lived in their tents as before.

name: 2 Kings 13:6
text: Nevertheless they didn"t depart from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, with which he made Israel to sin, but walked therein: and there remained the Asherah also in Samaria.)

name: 2 Kings 13:7
text: For he didn"t leave to Jehoahaz of the people any more than fifty horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the king of Syria destroyed them, and made them like the dust in threshing.

name: 2 Kings 13:8
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his might, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 2 Kings 13:9
text: Jehoahaz slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Samaria: and Joash his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 13:10
text: In the thirty-seventh year of Joash king of Judah, Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz began to reign over Israel in Samaria for sixteen years.

name: 2 Kings 13:11
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh; he didn"t depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin; but he walked therein.

name: 2 Kings 13:12
text: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his might with which he fought against Amaziah king of Judah, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 2 Kings 13:13
text: Joash slept with his fathers; and Jeroboam sat on his throne: and Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 13:14
text: Now Elisha was fallen sick of his sickness of which he died: and Joash the king of Israel came down to him, and wept over him, and said, "My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and its horsemen!"

name: 2 Kings 13:15
text: Elisha said to him, "Take bow and arrows;" and he took to him bow and arrows.

name: 2 Kings 13:16
text: He said to the king of Israel, "Put your hand on the bow;" and he put his hand on it. Elisha laid his hands on the king"s hands.

name: 2 Kings 13:17
text: He said, "Open the window eastward;" and he opened it. Then Elisha said, "Shoot!" and he shot. He said, "Yahweh"s arrow of victory, even the arrow of victory over Syria; for you shall strike the Syrians in Aphek, until you have consumed them."

name: 2 Kings 13:18
text: He said, "Take the arrows;" and he took them. He said to the king of Israel, "Strike the ground;" and he struck three times, and stopped.

name: 2 Kings 13:19
text: The man of God was angry with him, and said, "You should have struck five or six times. Then you would have struck Syria until you had consumed it, whereas now you shall strike Syria just three times."

name: 2 Kings 13:20
text: Elisha died, and they buried him. Now the bands of the Moabites invaded the land at the coming in of the year.

name: 2 Kings 13:21
text: It happened, as they were burying a man, that behold, they spied a band; and they cast the man into the tomb of Elisha: and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet.

name: 2 Kings 13:22
text: Hazael king of Syria oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.

name: 2 Kings 13:23
text: But Yahweh was gracious to them, and had compassion on them, and had respect to them, because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and would not destroy them, neither cast he them from his presence as yet.

name: 2 Kings 13:24
text: Hazael king of Syria died; and Benhadad his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 13:25
text: Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz took again out of the hand of Benhadad the son of Hazael the cities which he had taken out of the hand of Jehoahaz his father by war. Joash struck him three times, and recovered the cities of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 14:1
text: In the second year of Joash son of Joahaz king of Israel began Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah to reign.

name: 2 Kings 14:2
text: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Jehoaddin of Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 14:3
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, yet not like David his father: he did according to all that Joash his father had done.

name: 2 Kings 14:4
text: However the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

name: 2 Kings 14:5
text: It happened, as soon as the kingdom was established in his hand, that he killed his servants who had slain the king his father:

name: 2 Kings 14:6
text: but the children of the murderers he didn"t put to death; according to that which is written in the book of the law of Moses, as Yahweh commanded, saying, "The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, nor the children be put to death for the fathers; but every man shall die for his own sin."

name: 2 Kings 14:7
text: He killed of Edom in the Valley of Salt ten thousand, and took Sela by war, and called its name Joktheel, to this day.

name: 2 Kings 14:8
text: Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash, the son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, "Come, let us look one another in the face."

name: 2 Kings 14:9
text: Jehoash the king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, "The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, "Give your daughter to my son as wife. Then a wild animal that was in Lebanon passed by, and trampled down the thistle.

name: 2 Kings 14:10
text: You have indeed struck Edom, and your heart has lifted you up. Enjoy the glory of it, and stay at home; for why should you meddle to your harm, that you should fall, even you, and Judah with you?""

name: 2 Kings 14:11
text: But Amaziah would not listen. So Jehoash king of Israel went up; and he and Amaziah king of Judah looked one another in the face at Beth Shemesh, which belongs to Judah.

name: 2 Kings 14:12
text: Judah was defeated by Israel; and they fled every man to his tent.

name: 2 Kings 14:13
text: Jehoash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Jehoash the son of Ahaziah, at Beth Shemesh, and came to Jerusalem, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.

name: 2 Kings 14:14
text: He took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of Yahweh, and in the treasures of the king"s house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.

name: 2 Kings 14:15
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoash which he did, and his might, and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 2 Kings 14:16
text: Jehoash slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel; and Jeroboam his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 14:17
text: Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.

name: 2 Kings 14:18
text: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 14:19
text: They made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem; and he fled to Lachish: but they sent after him to Lachish, and killed him there.

name: 2 Kings 14:20
text: They brought him on horses; and he was buried at Jerusalem with his fathers in the city of David.

name: 2 Kings 14:21
text: All the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.

name: 2 Kings 14:22
text: He built Elath, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.

name: 2 Kings 14:23
text: In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah, Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel began to reign in Samaria for forty-one years.

name: 2 Kings 14:24
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: he didn"t depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

name: 2 Kings 14:25
text: He restored the border of Israel from the entrance of Hamath to the sea of the Arabah, according to the word of Yahweh, the God of Israel, which he spoke by his servant Jonah the son of Amittai, the prophet, who was of Gath Hepher.

name: 2 Kings 14:26
text: For Yahweh saw the affliction of Israel, that it was very bitter; for there was none shut up nor left at large, neither was there any helper for Israel.

name: 2 Kings 14:27
text: Yahweh didn"t say that he would blot out the name of Israel from under the sky; but he saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the son of Joash.

name: 2 Kings 14:28
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his might, how he warred, and how he recovered Damascus, and Hamath, which had belonged to Judah, for Israel, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 2 Kings 14:29
text: Jeroboam slept with his fathers, even with the kings of Israel; and Zechariah his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 15:1
text: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.

name: 2 Kings 15:2
text: Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.

name: 2 Kings 15:3
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.

name: 2 Kings 15:4
text: However the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

name: 2 Kings 15:5
text: Yahweh struck the king, so that he was a leper to the day of his death, and lived in a separate house. Jotham the king"s son was over the household, judging the people of the land.

name: 2 Kings 15:6
text: Now the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 15:7
text: Azariah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David: and Jotham his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 15:8
text: In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah, Zechariah the son of Jeroboam reigned over Israel in Samaria six months.

name: 2 Kings 15:9
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, as his fathers had done: he didn"t depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

name: 2 Kings 15:10
text: Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and struck him before the people, and killed him, and reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 15:11
text: Now the rest of the acts of Zechariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 15:12
text: This was the word of Yahweh which he spoke to Jehu, saying, "Your sons to the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel." So it came to pass.

name: 2 Kings 15:13
text: Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the thirty-ninth year of Uzziah king of Judah; and he reigned for a month in Samaria.

name: 2 Kings 15:14
text: Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and struck Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria, and killed him, and reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 15:15
text: Now the rest of the acts of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 15:16
text: Then Menahem struck Tiphsah, and all who were therein, and its borders, from Tirzah: because they didn"t open to him, therefore he struck it; and all the women therein who were with child he ripped up.

name: 2 Kings 15:17
text: In the nine and thirtieth year of Azariah king of Judah, Menahem the son of Gadi began to reign over Israel for ten years in Samaria.

name: 2 Kings 15:18
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: he didn"t depart all his days from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

name: 2 Kings 15:19
text: There came against the land Pul the king of Assyria; and Menahem gave Pul one thousand talents of silver, that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.

name: 2 Kings 15:20
text: Menahem exacted the money of Israel, even of all the mighty men of wealth, of each man fifty shekels of silver, to give to the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria turned back, and didn"t stay there in the land.

name: 2 Kings 15:21
text: Now the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

name: 2 Kings 15:22
text: Menahem slept with his fathers; and Pekahiah his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 15:23
text: In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria for two years.

name: 2 Kings 15:24
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: he didn"t depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

name: 2 Kings 15:25
text: Pekah the son of Remaliah, his captain, conspired against him, and struck him in Samaria, in the castle of the king"s house, with Argob and Arieh; and with him were fifty men of the Gileadites: and he killed him, and reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 15:26
text: Now the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 15:27
text: In the two and fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekah the son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria for twenty years.

name: 2 Kings 15:28
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: he didn"t depart from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin.

name: 2 Kings 15:29
text: In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abel Beth Maacah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali; and he carried them captive to Assyria.

name: 2 Kings 15:30
text: Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah, and struck him, and killed him, and reigned in his place, in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.

name: 2 Kings 15:31
text: Now the rest of the acts of Pekah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 15:32
text: In the second year of Pekah the son of Remaliah king of Israel began Jotham the son of Uzziah king of Judah to reign.

name: 2 Kings 15:33
text: He was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Jerusha the daughter of Zadok.

name: 2 Kings 15:34
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh; he did according to all that his father Uzziah had done.

name: 2 Kings 15:35
text: However the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burned incense in the high places. He built the upper gate of the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Kings 15:36
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all that he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 15:37
text: In those days Yahweh began to send against Judah Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah.

name: 2 Kings 15:38
text: Jotham slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Ahaz his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 16:1
text: In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.

name: 2 Kings 16:2
text: Twenty years old was Ahaz when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and he didn"t do that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh his God, like David his father.

name: 2 Kings 16:3
text: But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, yes, and made his son to pass through the fire, according to the abominations of the nations, whom Yahweh cast out from before the children of Israel.

name: 2 Kings 16:4
text: He sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.

name: 2 Kings 16:5
text: Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war: and they besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome him.

name: 2 Kings 16:6
text: At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath to Syria, and drove the Jews from Elath; and the Syrians came to Elath, and lived there, to this day.

name: 2 Kings 16:7
text: So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria, saying, "I am your servant and your son. Come up, and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria, and out of the hand of the king of Israel, who rise up against me."

name: 2 Kings 16:8
text: Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in the house of Yahweh, and in the treasures of the king"s house, and sent it for a present to the king of Assyria.

name: 2 Kings 16:9
text: The king of Assyria listened to him; and the king of Assyria went up against Damascus, and took it, and carried its people captive to Kir, and killed Rezin.

name: 2 Kings 16:10
text: King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath Pileser king of Assyria, and saw the altar that was at Damascus; and king Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest the fashion of the altar, and its pattern, according to all its workmanship.

name: 2 Kings 16:11
text: Urijah the priest built an altar: according to all that king Ahaz had sent from Damascus, so Urijah the priest made it for the coming of king Ahaz from Damascus.

name: 2 Kings 16:12
text: When the king had come from Damascus, the king saw the altar: and the king drew near to the altar, and offered on it.

name: 2 Kings 16:13
text: He burnt his burnt offering and his meal offering, and poured his drink offering, and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings, on the altar.

name: 2 Kings 16:14
text: The bronze altar, which was before Yahweh, he brought from the forefront of the house, from between his altar and the house of Yahweh, and put it on the north side of his altar.

name: 2 Kings 16:15
text: King Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest, saying, "On the great altar burn the morning burnt offering, and the evening meal offering, and the king"s burnt offering, and his meal offering, with the burnt offering of all the people of the land, and their meal offering, and their drink offerings; and sprinkle on it all the blood of the burnt offering, and all the blood of the sacrifice; but the bronze altar shall be for me to inquire by."

name: 2 Kings 16:16
text: Urijah the priest did so, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.

name: 2 Kings 16:17
text: King Ahaz cut off the panels of the bases, and removed the basin from off them, and took down the sea from off the bronze oxen that were under it, and put it on a pavement of stone.

name: 2 Kings 16:18
text: The covered way for the Sabbath that they had built in the house, and the king"s entry outside, turned he to the house of Yahweh, because of the king of Assyria.

name: 2 Kings 16:19
text: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which he did, aren"t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

name: 2 Kings 16:20
text: Ahaz slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Kings 17:1
text: In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah, Hoshea the son of Elah began to reign in Samaria over Israel for nine years.

name: 2 Kings 17:2
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, yet not as the kings of Israel who were before him.

name: 2 Kings 17:3
text: Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant, and brought him tribute.

name: 2 Kings 17:4
text: The king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea; for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt, and offered no tribute to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year: therefore the king of Assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.

name: 2 Kings 17:5
text: Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land, and went up to Samaria, and besieged it three years.

name: 2 Kings 17:6
text: In the ninth year of Hoshea the king of Assyria took Samaria, and carried Israel away to Assyria, and placed them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

name: 2 Kings 17:7
text: It was so, because the children of Israel had sinned against Yahweh their God, who brought them up out of the land of Egypt from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and had feared other gods,

name: 2 Kings 17:8
text: and walked in the statutes of the nations, whom Yahweh cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel, which they made.

name: 2 Kings 17:9
text: The children of Israel did secretly things that were not right against Yahweh their God: and they built them high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city;

name: 2 Kings 17:10
text: and they set them up pillars and Asherim on every high hill, and under every green tree;

name: 2 Kings 17:11
text: and there they burnt incense in all the high places, as did the nations whom Yahweh carried away before them; and they worked wicked things to provoke Yahweh to anger;

name: 2 Kings 17:12
text: and they served idols, of which Yahweh had said to them, "You shall not do this thing."

name: 2 Kings 17:13
text: Yet Yahweh testified to Israel, and to Judah, by every prophet, and every seer, saying, "Turn from your evil ways, and keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers, and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets."

name: 2 Kings 17:14
text: Notwithstanding, they would not listen, but hardened their neck, like the neck of their fathers, who didn"t believe in Yahweh their God.

name: 2 Kings 17:15
text: They rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified to them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and followed the nations that were around them, concerning whom Yahweh had commanded them that they should not do like them.

name: 2 Kings 17:16
text: They forsook all the commandments of Yahweh their God, and made them molten images, even two calves, and made an Asherah, and worshiped all the army of the sky, and served Baal.

name: 2 Kings 17:17
text: They caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire, and used divination and enchantments, and sold themselves to do that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, to provoke him to anger.

name: 2 Kings 17:18
text: Therefore Yahweh was very angry with Israel, and removed them out of his sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.

name: 2 Kings 17:19
text: Also Judah didn"t keep the commandments of Yahweh their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.

name: 2 Kings 17:20
text: Yahweh rejected all the seed of Israel, and afflicted them, and delivered them into the hand of spoilers, until he had cast them out of his sight.

name: 2 Kings 17:21
text: For he tore Israel from the house of David; and they made Jeroboam the son of Nebat king: and Jeroboam drove Israel from following Yahweh, and made them sin a great sin.

name: 2 Kings 17:22
text: The children of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he did; they didn"t depart from them;

name: 2 Kings 17:23
text: until Yahweh removed Israel out of his sight, as he spoke by all his servants the prophets. So Israel was carried away out of their own land to Assyria to this day.

name: 2 Kings 17:24
text: The king of Assyria brought men from Babylon, and from Cuthah, and from Avva, and from Hamath and Sepharvaim, and placed them in the cities of Samaria instead of the children of Israel; and they possessed Samaria, and lived in the cities of it.

name: 2 Kings 17:25
text: So it was, at the beginning of their dwelling there, that they didn"t fear Yahweh: therefore Yahweh sent lions among them, which killed some of them.
